data.event: Caro began as a logging camp on the Cass River established by Curtis Emerson in 1847.

event.title: purchased 63 acres (250,000 m2) in the north half of the northwest quarter of section 3 in Indianfields Township on September 8, 1852

data.event: Later Samuel P. Sherman, who purchased 63 acres (250,000 m2) in the north half of the northwest quarter of section 3 in Indianfields Township on September 8, 1852.

His son, William E. Sherman, had worked in the lumber industry nearby on the Cass River for some time prior to 1852 and William's favorable report persuaded his father to visit in 1851 and afterwards purchased several tracts of land in addition to his initial purchase.

event.title: had been keeping a hotel in an old log house, in 1858

data.event: Melvin Gibbs, who had been keeping a hotel in an old log house, in 1858 put up a new frame building, known as the Gibbs House.
In 1859, William E. Sherman built another hotel, which he named the Centerville House, based on the location being near the center of the county.
